result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua D. Patton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Joshua D. Patton.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel provides an update to the court. Parties further request a status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 15 pages) commencing 08-26-2022 by Kristin Menzia.

Defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Joshua D. Patton.  Defendant's appearance waived.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense received discovery and pretrial offer; defense requested adjournment due to needing more time to communicate with defendant. Court granted defense's request. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; all parties to appear by zoom. Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua D. Patton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Joshua D. Patton.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judicial Notice to case 18CF3954. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer T. KOTNIK.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court by video, defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant was moved from Dodge to Racine and not scheduled to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court by video, defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in personfor the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Defendant is housed at Dodge. Dodge did not have todays hearing on their calendar. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harris recently appointed. Case is adjourned for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, defendant in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua D. Patton not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. n, via zoom.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST. Case set for Preliminary hearing. Public Defender's office request additional time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Joshua D. Patton in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Joshua D. Patton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joshua D. Patton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
